item.title: Verity add a quote by Charles Caleb Colton
item.description: "Some read to think, these are rare; some to write, these are common; and some read to talk, and these form the great majority. " -- Charles Caleb Colton

item.title: Verity add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"Libraries should be open to all - except the censor.
<i>[Response to questionnaire in Saturday Review, October 29 1960]</i>" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Verity add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.." -- John Milton

item.title: Verity add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "It had been only through books-at best, no more than vicarious cultural transfusions-that I had managaed to keep myself alive in a negatively vital way. Whenever my environment had failed to support or nourish me, I had clutched at books..." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Verity add a quote by Walter Moers
item.description: "Stealing from one author is plagiarism; from many authors, research." -- Walter Moers

item.title: Verity add a quote by Eloisa James
item.description: "He's male. I've noticed that sometimes the brains simply get left out of the package." -- Eloisa James
